alert.note: Alert for Charlotte; Manatee; Sarasota (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 3:15PM EDT until September 28 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Charlotte County in southwestern Florida... Manatee County in west central Florida... Sarasota County in west central Florida... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by Hurricane Ian. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Port, Sarasota, Punta Gorda, Port Charlotte, Myakka River State Park, Lake Sarasota, Gulf Gate Estates, South Gate Ridge, Sarasota Springs, Ridge Wood Heights, Southgate, South Sarasota, Warm Mineral Springs, Venice Gardens, South Venice, Nokomis, Laurel, Oscar Scherer State Park, Gulf Cove and Gator Creek Estate. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
